titleStmt.title: J. S. Foxworthy et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11322

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We whose names are hereto subscribed Humbly petitioning request & pray Beriah Magoffin ^Governor of Kentucky^ to remit a fine of $40 adjudged against Ms Matilda hobbs by the Nelson Circuit Court at the present March Term 1862 for permitting negro woman Nancy to trade in some market stuff

The case recommends itself to executive cemency in this -- that Ms Hobbs is an old and very respectable lady and there was no intent on her part to make a breack of the law -- the only testimony against her own son a youth who resides with his mother -- and the fine being fixed by the statute the jury had no discretion on the amount -- we ask a remisson except as to the Commonwealths attorneys part of same

J S Foxworthy
Thos Newman
Crawford Juror
Joseph Smith
H F Jennings Juror
J S Wilson
G M Hays
Felix G Rogen
Chas. E. Wison
Jospeh Meen
Austin J. Mattingly
Jas. S. Smith Jr
John Morton
William F. Lewis
Wm Taylor
T. S. Foxworthy
Wm Gilbert
Jermiah Anderson
Samuel Clark
James M Graham
R F Hagan
Philip Fulkerson
James Hite
D. S. S
T P Linthicum
J. W. Muir
Wm Wilson
J. P. Elliott
John E Newman
T. W. Samuels
Simon Humphrey
James Wood
John Mammell
Joseph Hart
Geo. W. Hite
Saml Talbott
T. J. Wood
W. H Slaughter
Alfred R Carothers
D M Kelly
Ben L
Ed Bennet
I McHaydon
I H Taylor
John H. Lilly
W F McGill Juror
S W Collings
Richard Wayne
James Crume

Nelson Cir. Ct
$40. } Mis --
Mrs M. Hobbs
Issd Apr 24. 1862
